wordpressPost.title: Employee Engagement News Roundup 10/23/2015
wordpressPost.content:
The WeSpire Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup aggregates the top employee engagement articles from around the industry to keep you informed and inspire positive impact in your organization.

The 3 Best Metrics for Effective Employee Engagement

As Millennials continue to flood corporate America and challenge the status quo, organizations are being forced to reevaluate how they engage employees and capture important data. As the article states, gone are the days of annual reviews and surveys; employees crave more frequent input and involvement. What does this mean for employers? The author explains it’s all about asking the right questions, constantly measuring engagement, utilizing technology and delivering on the results. Doing so will help prepare your company for success.

Why Leaders Should Place Company Values on the Same Level as Profits

A study done by Cone Communications and Echo Research Group revealed 82% of consumers are concerned with a company’s corporate social responsibility (CSR) when choosing to purchase a product. These external factors play an integral role in a company’s success, but the real influence comes from within. When your employees understand how every action ties back to a bigger purpose, they’ll take more pride in their everyday tasks, be more productive and exude an authentic outward appearance. This article explains best practices for creating this type of culture: back your mission, define your vision, lead by example, and recognize/reward behavior your organization wants to encourage.

Has corporate social responsibility become the modern gold rush?

Companies that focus efforts on corporate social responsibility are not only becoming more common, but they also a unique competitive advantage. Patagonia, Starbucks, and Unilever are three examples of companies committed to making positive change for a social cause. The results of their efforts include exponential growth, increased brand loyalty, and a benchmark for other companies to follow suit. Sustainability expert Susan McPherson explains the race is on; increased competition will only further promote healthy competition and innovation for the greater good.

3 HR Trends That Are Becoming Best Practices

A July CareerBuilder survey revealed over 65% of CEOs believe Human Resources opinions carry greater weight with senior management than any other department. Over 73% also admitted their HR leader has impacted their business strategy in more ways than one. Executives are quickly realizing HR’s unique role within an organization: they have the ability to communicate and understand employees on an individual and companywide level. As this new partnership grows, HR departments are finding new ways to capture more data, automate processes, and innovate through the implementation of technology.

Why The Annual Performance Review Is Going Extinct

A study done by BetterWorks revealed managers who set weekly goals with their teams and had periodic check-ins noticed employees were 24 times more likely to reach those goals. Already, experts such as Josh Bersin and Laszlo Block have eliminated their annual review processes and the benefits that have resulted. The author believes these improvements stem from more frequent feedback, clearer goals and a stronger connection between managers and employees.
